analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag bcu drug pa /
translated: The Bhagavān has sixteen hands,

original: bdag med mas 'khyud pa /
analyzed: bdag med mas 'khyud pa /

original: lha mo brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: lha mo brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku mdog dang phyag gi mtshon cha @175b dang / spro ba dang sdud pa'i sku bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine the form of emanation and withdrawal, with the colors and hand implements of the deities as will be explained.

original: de'i mdun du goo r'i nag mo phyag na zla ba byang chub kyi sems dang / g-yas su chom rkun ma btsod kyi mdog can phyag na nyi ma ste rang byung gi me tog ces bya ba dang / rgyab tu ro langs ma ser mo phyag na rdo rje'i chu'i snod dang /

translated: In front of him is black Gaurī holding a moon of bodhicitta. To the right is red Caurī holding a sun, called “self-arisen flower.” In back is yellow Vetālī holding a vajra water vessel.

original: g-yon du ghasma r'i sngo bsangs gsang ba'i sman 'dzin pa dang / mdun gyi g-yon zur du spos mo sngon mo rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i stobs 'dzin pa dang / mdun gyi g-yas zur du ri khrod ma dkar mo phyag na ro'i rgyun dang / rgyab kyi g-yas zur du gtum mo kun nas dmar bar cang te'u 'khrol ba dang /
analyzed: g-yon du ghasma r'i sngo bsangs gsang ba'i sman 'dzin pa dang / mdun gyi g-yon zur du spos mo sngon mo rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i stobs 'dzin pa dang / mdun gyi g-yas zur du ri khrod ma dkar mo phyag na ro'i rgyun dang / rgyab kyi g-yas zur du gtum mo kun nas dmar bar cang te'u 'khrol ba dang /

original: rgyab kyi g-yon zur du g-yung mo dud ka rang gi sku la 'khyud pa ste /
analyzed: rgyab kyi g-yon zur du g-yung mo dud ka rang gi sku la 'khyud pa ste /
translated: In the back left corner is Pukkasī, smoke-colored, embracing her own body.

original: rnal 'byor mi 'di rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i bcom ldan 'das bkug cing brtan par byas nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor mi 'di rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i bcom ldan 'das bkug cing brtan par byas nas /
translated: Having summoned and stabilized the Bhagavān surrounded by these yoginīs,

original: de nas 'od zer de rnams snying ga'i sa bon la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'od zer de rnams snying ga'i sa bon la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: then those light rays should be brought into the seed syllable in the heart.

original: slar yang sa bon de las mthon pa'i phyi dang gsang ba dang de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: slar yang sa bon de las mthon pa'i phyi dang gsang ba dang de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod par bya ste /
translated: Again, one should offer to the Bhagavān with the special outer, secret, and suchness offerings arising from that seed syllable.

original: de la me tog dang bdug pa dang mar me dang zhal zas dang rin po che bdun po la sogs pa rnams stobs pa ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de la me tog dang bdug pa dang mar me dang zhal zas dang rin po che bdun po la sogs pa rnams stobs pa ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The offering of flowers, incense, lamps, food, and the seven precious articles is the outer offering.

original: lha mo brgyad kyis bdun rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga stobs pa zhes bya ba gsang ba'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad kyis bdun rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga stobs pa zhes bya ba gsang ba'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The offering of the five ambrosias and the five lights by the eight goddesses is the secret offering.

original: bla ma'i man ngag las bdag med pa dang lhan cig ro gcig pa'i dga' bas gnyis su myong ba ni de kho na nyid kyis chod pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag las bdag med pa dang lhan cig ro gcig pa'i dga' bas gnyis su myong ba ni de kho na nyid kyis chod pa'o //
translated: The experience of nonduality through the joy of being one taste with Nairātmya is the offering of suchness.

original: yang dag par mchod cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mngon du phyag byas nas de'i spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par mchod cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mngon du phyag byas nas de'i spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Having made the perfect offering and prostrated with body, speech, and mind, one should confess one’s sins, and so on, in front of him.

original: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor pa'i dam pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams kyis bdag gis sdig pa'i las bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni bshags shing slar mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor pa'i dam pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams kyis bdag gis sdig pa'i las bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni bshags shing slar mi bgyi'o //
translated: I confess them all and will do so no more.

original: so so'i skye bo dang lha rnams dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang lha rnams dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in the roots of virtue of all ordinary beings, gods, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, perfect buddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: I dedicate all roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas @176a * //
analyzed: de nas @176a * //
translated: Then,

original: khams gsum po kun gyi bdag nyid bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i he ru ka rdo rje sangs rgyas dang / des bstan pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos dang / de'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i dge 'dun la /
analyzed: khams gsum po kun gyi bdag nyid bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i he ru ka rdo rje sangs rgyas dang / des bstan pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos dang / de'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i dge 'dun la /
translated: and to the Sangha of yoginis abiding in his circle,

analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i bar ji srid par skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: until the essence of enlightenment is reached.🔽I will generate the Thought of Enlightenment, the nature of great bliss, the perfect enlightenment, the emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa /🔽rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o //

translated: which is the cause for the performance of the aim of all sentient beings.

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin pa rdo rje'i theg pa la bdag gis brten par bgyi'o //
translated: I will rely on the Vajra Vehicle, which is the path to the unsurpassed enlightenment of these.

original: de'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir lus dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir lus dbul bar bya'o //
translated: After that, in order to perfect the perfection of generosity, one should offer one’s body.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i slad du bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mgon po la gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i slad du bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mgon po la gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: One should supplicate the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas to turn the wheel of dharma.

original: 'khor bar gnas pa'i bar du bzhugs su gsol ba rnams byas nas /
analyzed: 'khor bar gnas pa'i bar du bzhugs su gsol ba rnams byas nas /
translated: One should supplicate them to remain in saṃsāra for as long as it exists.

original: de nas sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa lta bur lha'i bde bas nye bar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi byams pa chen po dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi chu gter du bying zhing skyabs med pa'i sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyi snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: de nas sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa lta bur lha'i bde bas nye bar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi byams pa chen po dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi chu gter du bying zhing skyabs med pa'i sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyi snying rje chen po dang /
translated: Then, with a nature of longing for the happiness of the higher realms for all sentient beings, as if they were one’s only child, one should meditate on great love. With a nature of longing to separate all sentient beings from suffering and the causes of suffering, as if they were one’s only child, who is drowning in the ocean of all conceptual thoughts and has no refuge, one should meditate on great compassion.

original: bde ba chen po dang ma bral bas yongs su tshim pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dga' ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi gnyen po'i lam gyis nye bar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi btang snyoms bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po dang ma bral bas yongs su tshim pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dga' ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi gnyen po'i lam gyis nye bar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi btang snyoms bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should cultivate the joy that has the characteristic of complete satisfaction, since one is never separated from great bliss, and the equanimity that has the aspect of being sustained by the path that is the antidote to the eight worldly concerns.

original: 'di rnams bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams bla na med pa'o //
translated: These are the unsurpassed.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba tsam gyi chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mos shing don de mthong zhing snang bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid kyi snying pos bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba tsam gyi chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mos shing don de mthong zhing snang bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid kyi snying pos bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: By means of the wisdom that has the characteristic of the thorough differentiation of phenomena, one should cultivate the view of the absence of intrinsic arising of all phenomena that are mere dependent origination, and since one sees and illuminates that meaning, and since one is subsumed by the essence of the reality of all things without exception,

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a w'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i sngags 'di dag yid kyis brjod nas /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a w'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i sngags 'di dag yid kyis brjod nas /
translated: one should recite mentally the mantra Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: bla ma dam pa'i man ngag las /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i man ngag las /
translated: Through the instructions of the sublime guru,

original: ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa'i gnas la /
analyzed: ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa'i gnas la /
translated: one should meditate on the view of the absence of intrinsic arising.

original: mi gnas @176b pa'i tshul gyis yud tsam du gnas so //
analyzed: mi gnas @176b pa'i tshul gyis yud tsam du gnas so //
translated: It abides for a moment without abiding.

original: 'di ni 'od gsal zhing dga' bar bya ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid gang yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'od gsal zhing dga' bar bya ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid gang yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is the reality of the Dharma that is to be expressed as clear light and joy.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin te bdud thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin te bdud thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom, which pacifies all demons.

original: de'i rjes su smon lam gyi nus pa'i shugs las de nas 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su smon lam gyi nus pa'i shugs las de nas 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i rnam pas /
translated: After that, by the force of the power of the strength of aspiration, then, from the state of arising from the samādhi of clear light,

original: re pha las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'u% sngon po yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: re pha las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'u% sngon po yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: on top of a sun maṇḍala arisen from reḥḥ, a blue hūṃ completely transforms,

original: 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje bsgom par bya ste /
translated: and one should meditate on a five-colored vajra cross.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje de'i 'od zer 'jig pa'i dus kyi me ltar bzod par dga' ba thams cad du spros pas /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje de'i 'od zer 'jig pa'i dus kyi me ltar bzod par dga' ba thams cad du spros pas /
translated: The light rays of that vajra cross, like the fire at the time of destruction, radiate everywhere, blazing like fire.

original: rdo rje'i ra ba stug por gyur cing rgyar ji tsam 'dod pa'i thad kar gru bzhi pa 'bar ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i ra ba stug por gyur cing rgyar ji tsam 'dod pa'i thad kar gru bzhi pa 'bar ba ste /
translated: The vajra fence becomes dense, square, and blazing in the horizontal direction as much as one wishes.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje'i gur dang / 'og tu de las rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis ni /
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje'i gur dang / 'og tu de las rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis ni /
translated: Above that, there is a vajra fence and below that, the ground is made of vajras.🔽

original: sa 'og gi bar du rnam par bkra ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og gi bar du rnam par bkra ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: Above that, one should see the enclosure of vajras and below that, the ground below is variegated with the nature of vajras.

original: de nas nyi ma dang sna tshogs rdo rje las 'od zer byung ba phyogs bral du spros nas /
analyzed: de nas nyi ma dang sna tshogs rdo rje las 'od zer byung ba phyogs bral du spros nas /
translated: Then, light rays come from the sun and the vajra cross and spread out in the directions.

original: de thams cad brtan por bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad brtan por bya'o //
translated: All of that should be made firm.

original: de'i dbus su bhr'um yig ser po yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bhr'um yig ser po yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: In the center of that, the yellow syllable bhrūṃ completely transforms into

original: 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa 'khor zhing mi g-yo ba dang mtshungs pa /

analyzed: dbang bskur bzhin @182a * //

analyzed: de nas yam yig las skyes pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor nag po //
translated: Then, on a wind mandala arisen from the syllable yaṃ, black,

analyzed: de'i steng du re pha yongs su gyur pa me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po //

analyzed: de'i steng du bh'um a'am dzr'im kham h'u% ste 'di rnams yongs su gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga po rang rang gi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: On top of that, bhum, a, jri, kham, and hau completely transform into the five nectars and the five lamps, which are the nature of the five tathagatas, consecrated by their individual seed syllables.

original: de'i steng du aom yig las kha chod kyi rnam pa a'a:yig yongs su gyur pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i steng du aom yig las kha chod kyi rnam pa a'a:yig yongs su gyur pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: On top of that, an ah syllable arises from an om syllable in the form of a cover, which completely transforms into a moon mandala.

original: de'i steng du h'u% las byung ba'i rdo rje de'i sa bon gyis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'u% las byung ba'i rdo rje de'i sa bon gyis mtshan pa'o //
translated: On top of that, a vajra arises from a hau syllable, marked with its seed syllable.

analyzed: de nas rlung g-yos pas mes rdo rje ma gtogs pa thams cad du zhu bar gyur nas thod pa'i nang du gnas pa /
translated: Then, the wind stirs, and the fire melts everything except the vajra, which remains in the skull cup.

analyzed: lan bzhi 'am lngar 'phyung zhing 'phyung ba'i bdud rtsi de /

analyzed: rdo rje yongs su mnyes nas zhu bar gyur pa de nyid du lhung bar gyur pa /

analyzed: de'i rjes su aom a'a:h'u% zhes pa'i yi ge gsum gyis khams gsum na gnas pa'i bdud rtsi bkug nas de nyid du bzhugs pa /
translated: Then, with the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ, the amṛta of the three realms is summoned and dissolves into the skull cup.

original: de rnams nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni /
translated: Blessing those substances:

translated: The wheel and so on means that on the tip of the Bhagavān’s tongue one should visualize a white vajra the size of a grain, arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku rdo rje'i ljags de nyid kyis bdud rtsi myang bar byas zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku rdo rje'i ljags de nyid kyis bdud rtsi myang bar byas zhing /
translated: The Bhagavān’s vajra tongue tastes the amṛta.

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang mkha' 'gro ma lha mo rnams la ni zhal nas zhal du ji ltar bde bar sbyin @182b par bya'o //
translated: The yoginīs and the ḍākinīs are given the amṛta from mouth to mouth.

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a mri ta sa da badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod nas /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i spros pa lhung mdzad rdo rje kye //
translated: You make the illusory elaborations fall, O Vajra!

analyzed: dgyes mdzad dpal ldan he ru ka rdo rje //

analyzed: zhes pa'i rdo rje'i glus bstod par bya zhing //

analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bdag nyid bstod pa ni drug pa'o zhes pa yan lag drug bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: 'khor lo myur du rab tu grub par byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas bsgoms pa'i mthu las grub pa'i mtshan ma blta bar bya ste //

translated: From that, it becomes like a dream.

translated: From that, when one attains the state of the inseparability of sleep and waking, like a ripe fruit, the practitioner of the mudra becomes accomplished by the great mudra.

analyzed: de nas goo r'i la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad @183a * //
translated: Then, the eight yoginīs, such as Gaurī,

analyzed: dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo yang phyogs bcu rnams su bar mtshams med par spros nas /
translated: and the principal of the maṇḍala emanate without interstice into the ten directions.

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gdul bya'i sems can rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su sprul te /
translated: They emanate various forms for the various sentient beings to be tamed.

analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don byas nas de bsdus te /
translated: Having performed the desired aim, he gathers it in.

analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor du byas nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Having made it into his maṇḍala, he should view it as the nature of great bliss.

analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya nye bar bstan pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar khams gsum po kun nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor mos par bya zhing /

translated: Having understood that these also arise from bodhicitta, the source of great bliss, which is the single taste of wisdom and method,

analyzed: rang gi sku'i zhal brgyad du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: one should gather the eight goddesses, Gaurī, and so on, into one’s eight mouths.

analyzed: de'i rjes su zhal bdun po ni zhal gyi gtso bo la bsdu'o //
translated: After that, the seven faces are gathered into the principal face.

analyzed: de bzhin du phyag bcu bzhi mtshan ma dang bcas pa ni phyag gi gtso bo gnyis kyi nang du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the fourteen hands with implements should be contemplated as being inside the two principal hands.

analyzed: de nas zhabs gnyis ni zhabs kyi gtso bo gnyis la bsdu'o //

original: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ni /

analyzed: khams gsum po mtha' dag gcig pa'i skur mngon par bltas nas /
translated: is seen as the single body of the entire three realms.

analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i 'khor lo bzhi po rgyas gdab ste /
translated: The four wheels are sealed in their respective places.

analyzed: de la lte ba'i 'og tu rnam par gnas pa'i 'khor lor kha dog sna tshogs pa'i padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, in the wheel located below the navel, there is a multicolored lotus with sixty-four petals.

analyzed: de'i snying por aom yig nag po'i sa bon 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa gyen du bltas pa'o //

analyzed: snying ga chos kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma dkar po brgyad dang de'i dbus su h'u% yig sngon po'o //

analyzed: de la 'dab ma brgyad la bhr'u% a'a% dzri% kha% rnams te phyogs su'o //

analyzed: phyogs bral du ni ae wam ma ya'o //
